title: Pooja wants to sell a watch at a profit of 20%. She bought it at 10% less and sold it at Rs 30 less, but still she gained 20%. What is the cost price of the watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let Cost price of Watch is X… She bought it at 10% less..so .90X She Wants to Sell it at a profit of 20% or 1.20X But She Sold it at 30rs. Less…So 1.20x-30rs. But She Still Gained 20%…So Selling price is .90x120%=1.08X So the Equation is 1.20X-30=1.08X Or .12X=30 X=30/.12=250rs. Now Lets Check- Cost price 250 She bought it @@10% less..so 250-10% of 250=225 Originally she Want to sell it at a profit of 20% on cost price =250×120%=300rs. But She sold it at 30rs. Less..so S.p=270 Profit %=270-225/225=20% So It's verified…

Let the original cost price be X, perhaps originally she wanted to sell it at a price of 1.2X. but now she purchased it for 0.9X and sold it for 1.2X - 30 and gained 20%profit. Therefore 1.2X -30 = 1.20 * 0.9X. Solving it (1.20 - 1.08)*X = 30 X = 30/ .12 = ₹250 she actually purchased for 225(10% less than 250) and sold it for ₹270(ie 1.2 of 250–30).Still she gained 20% of the actual purchase price. 270 is 1.20 times of 225. thanx
